attributes.additional_details: On a £500 insurance policy this adds a tax (for the privilege of taking out a policy, be it house insurance, car insurance, holiday insurance and pet insurance) of £50 to your Policy  and pro rata according to the amount you pay for your Policy. This is a statutory amount payable on EVERY policy you take out and so you are paying this tax on every Policy you have. You are not paying once, but a number of times. The IPT compulsory charge is making insurance policies unaffordable and is yet another `hidden` tax which is making us all poorer. Please sign the Petition to have IPT removed.
attributes.background: A tax known as IPT (Insurance Premium Tax) was added to all insurance policies by the last government and was originally levied at 6%. Recently this has risen to 9% and due to become 10% in October 2016.
